alert.note: Alert for Hampden; Hampshire (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 11:21PM EST until December 19 at 6:00AM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Massachusetts... Westfield River At Westfield affecting Hampden and Hampshire Counties. For the Westfield River...including Westfield...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Westfield River at Westfield. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.5 feet, Businesses in low lying sections along the river through Westfield should take action to protect materials that are in flood prone areas at stages around 13.50 feet. Localized flooding in the Frogs Hole area is expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 PM EST Monday the stage was 13.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 13.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 PM EST Monday was 15.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tonight and continue falling to 7.6 feet Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.7 feet on 09/02/2021. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 600 AM EST.
